history.text: Hey how are you doing?
Good, how you doing todoya?
wow typos, today.
Really good just looking for a new movie to watch.
Awesome. Do you typically like dramas?
I definitely do, also action movies, both are my favorite genres.
Those are the best. I'm looking at a movie from 2010, is that too old for you?
Or do you not have a preference.
2010 is fine, whats the name of the movie?
The movie is The Social Network, have you seen it?
I have not, who stars in it?
It stars Jesse Eisenberg as Mark Zuckerberg and Andrew Garfield
But there is also Justin Timberlake in the film as well.
Sounds like a good cast, I like Justin Timberlake, what is the movie about?
The movie is a biographical drama about Mark Zuckerberg creating Facebook and the drama that enfolds between business partnerships.
Sounds really interesting, I enjoy those kinda of movies, any specific scenes that were intense or dramatic?
Yeah definitely, one of the big things that happened before Facebook was when Mark was broken up with by his girlfriend.
He created a website called Facemash, which is a place to steal females photos and post them, rating them on their attractiveness.
I bet she regrets that now haha, and oh wow i didnt realize he did that, guess he's a pretty mean guy after all
I wonder if facebook would've took off if people knew that
Yeah, you're telling me. Also, Facebook used to go by "The Facebook" and adapted the term "Facebook me"
Napster was one of the first people that were interested in Facebook.
I don't knoww either, I feel like that's a pretty shady website that he made before.
Interesting, I didn't know that either, any other cool scenes in the movie?
So far, just that after Mark made a deal, he moved from Palo Alto, California to New York.
I think i'll definitely check it out then, seeing how facebook was created would be really intriguing.
The movie has received a lot of high ratings as well.
What was in new york?
Oh really, how about the ratings, I'd love to see them.
Yeah, Rotten Tomatoes gave the movie a 96% or a 9 out of 10 rating, which is kinda crazy.
The Metacritic Score was 95/100 as well!
95/100 is amazing, sounds like I should definitely watch it, must be up with the top movies in 2010.
Definitely, I would watch it for the cast lineup on its own.
As for drama, there is a huge lawsuit in the film, I don't want to give too much away.
But basically, Andrew Garfield accuses Mark Zuckerberg of stealing the whole idea.
That sounds intense, thanks for not spoiling it. Sounds like Mark was quite a shady character.

uid1response.feedback: I like dramas and he made it seem like the social network has a strong amount of intense drama.
